metadata.title: CVE-2023-49462 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
libheif v1.17.5 was discovered to contain a segmentation violation via thecomponent /libheif/exif.cc.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-49462` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

heif-gdk-pixbuf - 1.17.6-1ubuntu4
heif-thumbnailer - 1.17.6-1ubuntu4
libheif-examples - 1.17.6-1ubuntu4
libheif-plugin-aomdec - 1.17.6-1ubuntu4
libheif-plugin-aomenc - 1.17.6-1ubuntu4
libheif-plugin-dav1d - 1.17.6-1ubuntu4
libheif-plugin-ffmpegdec - 1.17.6-1ubuntu4
libheif-plugin-j2kdec - 1.17.6-1ubuntu4
libheif-plugin-j2kenc - 1.17.6-1ubuntu4
libheif-plugin-jpegdec - 1.17.6-1ubuntu4
libheif-plugin-jpegenc - 1.17.6-1ubuntu4
libheif-plugin-libde265 - 1.17.6-1ubuntu4
libheif-plugin-rav1e - 1.17.6-1ubuntu4
libheif-plugin-svtenc - 1.17.6-1ubuntu4
libheif-plugin-x265 - 1.17.6-1ubuntu4
libheif1 - 1.17.6-1ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libheif package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.17.6-1ubuntu4').
